publicationStmt.publisher: These are to be soulde in Pawles Churchyard at the Brasen Serpent by Robert Dexter.,

notesStmt.note: Elizabeth I, Queen of England, is the author according to STC.
Verse: Ye precious shelles that lie on Lybian shore, or Nilus sable sandes in needelesse store, ...
Imperfect: letterpress portion only; cut up and pasted together.

The two long columns of verse are probably originally on either side of W. Roger's engraved, "Eliza triumphans"; see Hind I.263 and pl.138. There may also have been an emblem with the 3 stanzas pasted at the bottom. Cf. STC.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: Pawles Churchyard at the Brasen Serpent
